Description: Rim fragment of Milesian pottery plate; underside glazed with added red lines; on top of rim thinly spread lotus and rosette frieze, bounded on inside by a narrow square and dot frieze; band with added red band at outside of floor.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 222, no. 95)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 153-4, Nau 123, pl.26h)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 103, pl. XXX, no. 308.8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.909)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5980 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
